channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Conclave Nears, Catholics Wonder if New Pope Will Support Latin Mass
item.description: In Detroit, traditionalist Catholics were bracing for a crackdown. The promise of change in Rome offers them a sliver of hope.

item.title: Trump says he would extend TikTok deadline if no deal is reached by June 19: ‘I have a little warm spot in my heart for TikTok’
item.description: Says the app "will be protected" despite privacy/security concerns.

item.title: In the Battle for Next Pope, Cardinal Erdö Emerges as a Conservative Favorite
item.description: The archbishop is a standard-bearer for those in the church who favor a return to traditional rules and doctrine after Pope Francis.

item.title: Why you should be walking after every meal, according to science
item.description: Getting your steps in post-meal has numerous health benefits.

item.title: This Year’s Met Gala Raises the Most Money in Its History
item.description: The Met’s annual fashion party has become a fund-raising juggernaut, but the lavish event comes with a price tag of its own. How much bang does it get...

item.title: Why the world’s best hope for health-care innovation is not America, but India
item.description: India is showing what health-care innovation looks like, while U.S. funding goes to research and projects that rarely scale.

item.title: How New York City Routinely Fails to Pay the Nonprofits It Relies On
item.description: The city owes at least $1 billion to nonprofits for more than 7,000 unpaid invoices, according to a new report. The organizations provide critical ser...

item.title: Sunoco buying Parkland for $9 billion to create largest retail fueling and convenience store giant in the Americas
item.description: Canada's Parkland is selling after losing a bitter proxy fight to billionaire Kyffin Simpson.

item.title: European Union launches $566 million drive to attract researchers scared off by Trump moves on science and universities
item.description: “No one would have thought that one of the biggest democracies in the world would delete with a stroke the ability of one researcher or another to obt...

item.title: Cable Theft in Spain Disrupts Train Travel for Thousands, Officials Say
item.description: Oscar Puente, the transport minister, said “a serious act of sabotage” had brought some service to a halt, delaying service into Monday.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Plan to Expand Israel’s Fight in Gaza Is Met With Skepticism
item.description: It is not clear how the Israeli prime minister’s plan to add tens of thousands of soldiers will fundamentally alter a dynamic seen over 18 months of c...

item.title: In the Battle for Next Pope, Cardinal Erdö Emerges as a Conservative Favorite
item.description: The archbishop is a standard-bearer for those in the church who favor a return to traditional rules and doctrine after Pope Francis.

item.title: Children Suffer From Malnutrition as Israel’s Blockade of Gaza Continues
item.description: It has been over 60 days since Israel ordered a halt to all humanitarian aid entering Gaza. Israel says the siege will continue until Hamas releases a...

item.title: As Trump Targets Researchers, Europe Makes a Pitch to Attract Scientists
item.description: The continent’s leaders are hoping to benefit as the Trump administration cuts support for research and threatens universities such as Harvard and Col...

item.title: Congress’s Fight Over Trump’s Agenda Runs Through Alaska
item.description: Republicans in Congress are clashing over whether to repeal Biden-era clean energy tax credits that are a lifeline for some of their constituents.
